Ahvothian.name: Ahvothian
Ahvothian.publicNotes: Ahvothians are feral and cunning fiends from an Abyssal realm of jungles, dinosaurs, and relentless brutality. They resemble humanoid dinosaurs with narrow, fanged heads similar to raptors and solid, heavy legs like sauropods. Relentless trackers and survivalists, ahvothians are skilled at navigating jungles and are most commonly encountered stalking prey or operating out of fortified ruins. Ahvothians have an uncanny affinity with reptiles, and they often use dinosaurs-particularly carnivores such as allosauruses or deinonychuses-as hunting companions or guard animals. Although dangerous in large groups, ahvothians have such a strong desire to assert dominance over others that ahvothian armies frequently fall to infighting and bloody battles for dominance within days, or even hours. The mightiest ahvothians might lead dozens of their kin and herds of carnivorous dinosaurs.

action->Reptile Master.name: Reptile Master
action->Reptile Master.description: When an ahvothian uses an innate spell against a reptile, the DC is 27 rather than 23.

action->Wicked Trophies.name: Wicked Trophies
action->Wicked Trophies.description:
An ahvothian chooses a creature type (such as animal, celestial, or humanoid) from which they currently carry a trophy from a past kill.

Their weapon Strikes against creatures of that type deal an additional [[/r 1d10]] damage and they gain a +2 status bonus on Intimidation checks against creatures of that type.

The ahvothian doesn't lose these bonuses if they lose the trophies. Once per day, an ahvothian can change the creature type of their wicked trophies in a ritual that takes 1 hour.

Nearly all ahvothians encountered on the Material Plane have selected humanoids as the focus of their wicked trophies.

rules.0: Target is subject of Wicked Trophies

Angazhan's Rake Trap.name: Angazhan's Rake Trap
Angazhan's Rake Trap.descriptionHazard: Six metal talons concealed in the walls swing out and rake across the room.
Angazhan's Rake Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:25|name:Disable a Talon|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to disable each talon

action->Raking Strike.name: Raking Strike
action->Raking Strike.description:
Trigger one of the pressure plates is depressed

Effect Six talons swing out from the walls, each striking a different random creature in the room. No creature can be struck by more than one talon until every creature in the room has been attacked by at least one talon.

equipment->Silver Religious Symbol of An.name: Silver Religious Symbol of Angazhan
equipment->Silver Religious Symbol of An.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

action->Bravery.name: Bravery
action->Bravery.description: When the guard rolls a success on a Will save against a fear effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, any time they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.

weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate).name: Acid Flask (Moderate)
weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 2d6 persistent acid damage, and 2 acid splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate).name: Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)
weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 2d8 fire damage, 2 persistent fire damage, and 2 fire splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

equipment->Alchemist's Tools Expanded.name: Alchemist's Tools Expanded
equipment->Alchemist's Tools Expanded.description: This mobile collection of vials and chemicals can be used for simple alchemical tasks. If you wear your alchemist's tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

consumable->Bomber's Eye Elixir (Lesser).name: Bomber's Eye Elixir (Lesser)
consumable->Bomber's Eye Elixir (Lesser).description:
Activate A Interact

This tincture lets you pinpoint your foes. For the next 5 minutes, your alchemical bomb Strikes reduce the circumstance bonus to AC your targets gain from cover by 1.

consumable->Cheetah's Elixir (Moderate).name: Cheetah's Elixir (Moderate)
consumable->Cheetah's Elixir (Moderate).description:
Activate A Interact

Enzymatic compounds in this elixir strengthen and excite the muscles in your legs. You gain a +10 foot status bonus to your Speed for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.j9zVZwRBVAcnpEkE]{Effect: Cheetah's Elixir (Moderate)}

consumable->Hunting Spider Venom.name: Hunting Spider Venom
consumable->Hunting Spider Venom.description:
This venom erodes its target's defenses, aiding the spider in securing prey.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, clumsy 2, and off-guard (1 round)

consumable->Antidote (Lesser).name: Antidote (Lesser)
consumable->Antidote (Lesser).description:
Activate A Interact

An antidote protects you against toxins. Upon drinking an antidote, you gain a +2 item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against poisons for 6 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.TjBxxlTvb6tJP1jS]{Effect: Antidote}

consumable->Elixir of Life (Lesser).name: Elixir of Life (Lesser)
consumable->Elixir of Life (Lesser).description:
Activate A Interact

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creatures natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain @Damage[(3d6+6)[healing]] Hit Points and gain +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.lPRuIRbu0rHBkoKY]{Effect: Elixir of Life}

action->Infused Items.name: Infused Items
action->Infused Items.description:
An Aspis technician carries the following infused items:

  • 2 - @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ktjFOp3U0wQD9t0Z]{Lesser Antidotes}
  • 2 - @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Moderate Acid Flasks}
  • 2 - @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Moderate Alchemist's Fires}
  • 2 - @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Lesser Elixirs of Life}

These items last for 24 hours or until the next time the technician makes their daily preparations.

action->Hunting Spider Venom.name: Hunting Spider Venom
action->Hunting Spider Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and off-guard (1 round)

action->Poison Weapon.name: Poison Weapon
action->Poison Weapon.description:
Requirements The Aspis technician is wielding a piercing or slashing weapon and has a free hand

Effect The Aspis technician applies a poison to the weapon.

action->Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
action->Quick Bomber.description: The Aspis technician Interacts to draw a bomb, then Strikes with it.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The Aspis technician deals an extra 2d6 precision precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Bounding Leap.name: Bounding Leap
action->Bounding Leap.description: Globblit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaps} twice; this movement doesn't provoke reactions. If he ends his movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, he can make a melee Strike against that enemy.

action->Commanding Croak.name: Commanding Croak
action->Commanding Croak.description: Globblit gives a loud, belching croak to compel his allies to action. Each boggard within 30 feet can use a reaction to Step, Stride, or Strike.

action->Smash and Slurp.name: Smash and Slurp
action->Smash and Slurp.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect Globblit makes a greatclub Strike and a tongue Strike against the same target. If the greatclub Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against his tongue Strike.

This counts as two attacks for Globblit's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after his Smash and Slurp.

action->Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
action->Swamp Stride.description: Globblit ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

action->Tongue Grab.name: Tongue Grab
action->Tongue Grab.description:
If Globblit hits a creature with his tongue, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by him. Unlike a normal grab, the creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of Globblit's tongue.

A creature can sever the tongue by succeeding at an AC 18 Strike and dealing at least 6 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to Globblit, it prevents him from using his tongue Strike until it regrows, which takes a week.

action->Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
action->Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by cold and water (@Damage[5d8[untyped]], @Damage[2d6[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by acid (area @Damage[2d6[healing]] HP); slowed by earth

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

action->Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh.name: Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh
action->Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh.description:
A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Pr1ruNTbzGn3H9w5]{Stone to Flesh} spell negates Cursebreaker's golem antimagic and its resistance to physical damage for 1 round.

A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify} spell reverses this effect immediately.

Fiendripping Blast Trap.name: Fiendripping Blast Trap
Fiendripping Blast Trap.descriptionHazard: A blast of energy damages all creatures within 20 feet, with particularly severe damage to fiends.
Fiendripping Blast Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:27|name:Identify Button Sequence|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to identify the proper sequence of buttons in the divots, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th level; counteract DC 25) to suppress the magical effect for 1 hour

action->Forceful Blast.name: Forceful Blast
action->Forceful Blast.description:
Trigger The door is touched without first pressing the correct sequence of buttons

Effect A blast of energy ripples outward from the door, dealing @Damage[4d10[force]] damage to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} and forcing them to make a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save.

Fiends treat the result of their saving throw as one degree worse.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}; while it is sickened, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Fuming Sludge.name: Fuming Sludge
Fuming Sludge.publicNotes:
The slurry from alchemical experiments is often as flammable as it is toxic. In especially volatile cases, a fuming sludge can form from ignited pools of unstable alchemical runoff. It resembles a charcoal-colored slurry studded with tiny embers, and it continually emits a thin haze of accelerant that amplifies the fires it starts.

A fuming sludge must consume the base chemicals of living creatures to survive and can instinctively identify the complex molecules found in most animate creatures. The first meal of many a fuming sludge is its accidental creator, but it soon moves on to hunt in lush forests or densely populated settlements. A fuming sludge can extrude a powerful pseudopod to strike its victims, but it can also eject portions of its body with peristaltic contractions. These rapidly-cooling globs of goo slow down fleeing prey, but the cold, crusty residue can also alert canny explorers to their presence.

action->Chemical Sense 60 feet.name: Chemical Sense 60 feet
action->Chemical Sense 60 feet.description: A fuming sludge detects nearby living and undead creatures by their complex chemical compositions, but it can't detect elementals or other creatures composed of a single element.

action->Smoldering Haze.name: Smoldering Haze
action->Smoldering Haze.description:
15 feet. The fuming sludge constantly emits incendiary smoke that creates @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} around it. The smoke doesn't impair the fuming sludge's chemical sense. A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn in the aura becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@Check[fortitude|dc:25] negates) and cannot recover from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage} for 1 round. It is then temporarily immune to the sickening effect of the smoldering haze for 1 minute.

A creature that is currently holding its breath, that doesn't need to breathe, or that's immune to poison is immune to the aura's sickened effect but not the concealment or inability to recover from persistent fire damage.

equipment->Silver Religious Symbol of An.name: Silver Religious Symbol of Angazhan
equipment->Silver Religious Symbol of An.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

action->Keen Eyes.name: Keen Eyes
action->Keen Eyes.description:
Paga gains a +2 circumstance bonus when using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to find @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} creatures within 30 feet of her.

When she targets an opponent that is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from her or hidden, she reduces the DC of the flat check to 3 for a concealed target or 9 for a hidden one.

Scroll Shock Trap.name: Scroll Shock Trap
Scroll Shock Trap.descriptionHazard: Five scroll symbols shoot electricity bolts around the room.
Scroll Shock Trap.disable:
@Check[thievery|dc:25|name:Counteract Magic|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 24)

@Check[thievery|dc:29|name:Disable Trap (Control Panel)|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable the entire trap from the hidden control panel beneath the central slab.
Scroll Shock Trap.reset: The trap deactivates 1 round after it has no target creatures and resets after 1 minute.
Scroll Shock Trap.routine:
(5 actions) Each disabled symbol reduces the trap's number of actions by 1.

For each of its actions, a different symbol shoots an electricity bolt at a random creature in the room. The trap doesn't take multiple attack penalties.
Scroll Shock Trap.stealth: (expert) or @Check[perception|dc:29|traits:action:seek] (expert) to spot the control panel

action->Symbol Stats (Each).name: Symbol Stats (Each)
action->Symbol Stats (Each).description:
Hardness 16

HP 64 (BT 32)

Resistances Electricity 15

Immunities Critical Hits, Object Immunities, Precision Damage

action->Control Panel Stats.name: Control Panel Stats
action->Control Panel Stats.description:
Hardness 18

HP 72 (BT 36)

Resistances Electricity 15

Immunities Critical Hits, Object Immunities, Precision Damage

action->Reactive Charge.name: Reactive Charge
action->Reactive Charge.description:
Trigger A creature without an Aspis Consortium badge approaches within 5 feet of a slab

Effect Both double doors leading out of the room shut and lock. While the trap is active, the doors must be battered open (Hardness 18; Panel HP 72 [BT 36]; @Check[athletics|dc:29|name:Batter Down Doors|traits:action:force-open] to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open}). The closest symbol to the triggering creature shoots an electricity bolt attack at it. The trap then rolls initiative.

Stalker Summoning Rune.name: Stalker Summoning Rune
Stalker Summoning Rune.descriptionHazard: The sand conceals a rune that summons an invisible stalker into this yard.
Stalker Summoning Rune.disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:25|name:Approach Rune] to approach without triggering the trap followed by @Check[arcana|dc:25|name:Erase Rune] (expert) or @Check[thievery|dc:27|name:Erase Rune|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to erase the rune, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th level; counteract DC 25) to counteract the rune

action->Summon Monster.name: Summon Monster
action->Summon Monster.description:
Trigger A creature that isn't openly bearing an Aspis Consortium badge crosses the center of the yard

Effect The trap summons an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.HKXa9E91WLy6dAZA]{Invisible Stalker}. The invisible stalker rolls initiative and remains for [[/gmr 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds}, after which the spell ends and the invisible stalker disappears. The invisible stalker also disappears if someone disables the trap before the duration expires.

The invisible stalker can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.
